abstract: Residents of Mosul, Iraq, celebrate Iraqi security forces' victory over Islamic State in city, indulging in pleasures like smoking cigarettes that were forbidden under militant group's almost two-year rule; challenge facing mostly Shiite Iraqi forces is to keep peace in areas they have liberated without punishing Sunni Arab population that initially welcomed Islamic State fighters.

keywords.value: Islamic State in Iraq and Syria (ISIS)
keywords.name: organizations

lead_paragraph: Residents of one district celebrated their liberation from the Islamic State, but Iraqi commanders acknowledged that there was still a degree of support in Mosul for the group.
snippet: Residents of one district celebrated their liberation from the Islamic State, but Iraqi commanders acknowledged that there was still a degree of support in Mosul for the group....

headline.main: Mosul Neighbors Wake Up to a Day Without ISIS
headline.print_headline: As Forces Start Clearing Mosul, Iraqis Cheer, Shave and Smoke
